bvzQSPKI0YZ5IFaXmeDfhA.text: Keeping in tradition with other strange Japanese brand names such as Pepsi Ice Cucumber and Water Salad Shop, the name of Hi Sushi Salsa is a conglomeration of one of my favourite foodstuffs and a Latin dance. The food here is so good that the cleverness of the name actually becomes more apparent: the Salsa bit is only there to describe the dancing of your taste buds across your mouth when you take your first bite. They've got a really nice window display to boot!As you walk in you take in the pleasant, cool and dark surroundings that include a post-modern water fountain and teppan tables. Our order included a 12 piece sashimi dish along with various other sushi platters, and the clear winner of the day: Scottish beef tataki with green leeks. The salads are special too. Though the prices are quite steep at this restaurant, your dining experience will be second to none. When you get up to leave this lovely restaurant, romantically set along the Camden canal, you might just not want to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Hi Sushi Salsa

nTiBEuF0qSjnUqcbhSsaEQ.text: Loads of nice choices on the menu (gyoza, tempura, sushi rolls), lots of staff and quick service. Interior is cool and music can be quite loud so it's better to go with a group of mates and order lots of food n drink.Check out the Japanese cartoons on the TV and go for the seating built into the ground (watch out sitting down if you have a skirt on!).Love going here and never have to book in advance.

OdMPYGZq35rg-FT9Q6ttlQ.text: I travel in all the way from Guildford just to eat here... it is that good. Marked them down 1 star because the staff are not quick to refill your all you can eat menu nor bring you your check. Otherwise... AMAZING!

aXhU598jCjfjZ3jDU0Newg.text: Really nice sushi and really unique restaurant with very friendly service, Camden has a huge variety of different restaurants and foods to try but i would 100% recommend Hi Sushi.

2Xn7hm_hA2pQI4uvVILmHw.text: Three words - All You Can Eat and by gum I can and I did! Hi Sushi is a little out of place in the grunge and grime of Camden lock, but during our six months living there, I was so glad it braved the goths to exist. Inside the door, you walk across a little bridge over a fountain to your seats. At first glance I thought we would be sitting cross legged on a cushion, Japanese style, but there is a hole cut into the floor for you to sit normally. Sweet, I hate eating uncomfortably. We always order the All You Can Eat menu, but there is a huge a la carte selection also. The All You Can Eat option consists of three mini menus. You choose about 6 things from each, tempura, noodles, edamame, miso soup etc, but the only actually All You Can Eat stuff is the sushi, which you can get again and again. The first time we went, we refilled the sushi about twice more. I felt like the blueberry girl from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, nearly had to get the quiet, smiling staff to roll me out the door. Since then we have reigned it in and I noticed that they have put a little warning note on the order sheet, that if you leave a load of food behind you, they will charge you for it. Well I totally agree, there are waif thin teenagers wasting away outside on the Lock and you're in here wasting food like a Sultan... tsk!Can't recommend Hi Sushi enough, I think it's about £13 each for the All You Can Eat option and the food is fantastic. You might want to fast for a few hours first, just to get your moneys worth :-)

QTqEv4GZKN6CIDKKISALSA.text: On several occasions I have threatened to never come back to this establishment but their fantastic all you can eat deal keeps me coming back. It starts with the staff not offering the "all you can eat menu" by default and their general despondent attitude once you resolve to ordering this. The restaurant boasts traditional Japanese low tables which I don't love either.With all this negativity in mind I keep heading back and the reason is that for all the food on offer for just £16.50 I'm willing to take all these setbacks. You can begin with a selection of 8 dishes as "starters". There is a fantastic choice from teriyaki to yakitori specialities as well as your expected miso soup and edamame.The sushi selection is limited to 8 selections but is very fresh. The 2 sushi chefs make all the portions on the spot guaranteeing you are getting a good experience. As the night goes on the portions have a tendency of becoming smaller but considering it is an all you can eat menu the really hungry can offset this by ordering moreThe decor is young and funky and loud music is played which isn't a problem for me. They also offer some very tasty and well priced cocktails including several variations of mojitos.To conclude, I'm not sure I would visit this Hi Sushi as often as I did if the price was not so favorable. However it is always nice to be able to fill up properly with decent sushi without having to worry too much about how it will hurt your wallet.

fQ6p7N1GyBmWdko53ZsqfA.text: Very Very good, fresh fresh fresh.. I was very impressed with the many assortments of rolls they had here.. the all you can eat is very good deal... the decor is modern Japanese if you're into that thing.. low tables and chairs, so if u eat to many, they will just roll you out the door.  Planning my next trip back and will def hit this spot up again.

LhVQRqdJaKpl8ov1GFS5zQ.text: Not bad sushibut VERY good bentococktails weren't bad eitherThe sitting in the floor thing is a novelty that soon wears off though

bjSDC6pdCkNFDemrMq2ANQ.text: If you love sushi and a fantastic atmosphere, then this is the place to take your paramour. Intimate tables for two or massive group tables for 10, a little mini-river complete with mini-bridge feature you can walk across, and two open-plan kitchens where you can watch the chefs create their delicious sushi and food. And it's not that pricey either - for £18, you can have all you can eat sushi and some Japanese food. All freshly made and delicious. if you love Japanese food and fancy restaurants at resonable prices, this is the place to go.

nz5-vZ6CGooX74MOZjbGsA.text: Love the all you can eat option for £15! My only complaint was after we finished round one it took forever to flag someone down to get more, we also had to ask three times for tap water. Service wasn't bad, just slow.

rr7mq-sJRbR98DSYc--ryQ.text: "This is a great sushi restaurant weather you want to dine in and have a lovely time or just grab some sushi to go. For the area, and the quality of food the prices are quite reasonable. I went here to celebrate handing in my dissertation and ordered a champagne cocktail with an actual flower in it, which I thought was really cool. If you are dining with someone who just can't quite get their head around eating raw fish Hi Sushi has a selection of bento boxes with cooked teriyaki dishes, the salmon is really good.  The restaurant is very classy with sunken tatimi seating ( sitting on the flour but there is space for your feet to hang its really quite unique) a sunken sushi bar, and an open kitchen, I am a big fan of this because if you can see into the kitchen they make sure its clean. The staff are friendly and very quick, and I have always had an enjoyable time at Hi Sushi"

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom

FqQKm-cdeO4Abt4z7Hnt4g.text: Conveniently located in right on Regent's Canal at Camden Lock, Hi Sushi Salsa is an awesome place to bring a large group. They have large, sunken in tables to give you that feel of sitting on the floor without the discomfort sitting on the floor, set aside from other tables so you don't feel so bad about being a bit loud. The food is good, lots of tame favourites for the unadventurous, plus a few interesting fusions of Japanese and Latin flavours (yes, the 'Salsa' is for more than just flare). There's a fixed price a la carte menu, again great if you've got a large number of people and want to order a bunch of different things, but can still keep the price reasonable for everyone. They have great cocktails too. Best to make a booking for Friday and Saturday nights as loads of people wander in from the Markets.

77J9x98-epSo1DZp963BKA.text: This is by far the most exquisite place I have been, I filled up on salmon and rice and my bulimia hasn't affected me as much as last night. I put my stinky feet out and displayed an unusual abundance of flatulence but nobody complained, excellent! However I will rate this restaurant 1 star because they did not set up a throne and sceptre for me, the rightful king and ruler of all people in the world, as I requested! They do not deserve to be ruled by me!

Lt2WKkp7MZ836DeHVcX0GQ.text: Ok, um, WHOA. Hi Sushi Salsa, are you serious?! £17 for all you can eat?!?! Including cooked items like tempura and teriyaki?!?!!? Omigod, I am so excited I can't stop using question marks and exclamation points??!?!?!?!?!?!?!?Ok, this place is crazy. For £17/head (not available on Saturdays), you get all you can eat (with stipulations) Japanese food. They've got a list of sushi and sashimi items that you can have unlimited portions of, as well as a list of cooked items. You order the unlimited stuff as you need/want it by ticking boxes on the little slip of paper where the options are listed, and you order the cooked items all at once, 7 items per couple. We tried to order just a few cooked things--tempura, a green salad, and some curried something--because we were anticipating filling up on sushi, but the waitress said that the portions of hot stuff were rather small and that we should get all 7. I wish we had stuck to our guns and only gotten a few, because it ended up being So! Much! Food! We only had room for a few sushi items after all of the hot stuff, which ended up being an order of salmon sashimi and a few small maki rolls. In the interest of full disclosure, the entire menu is not available for this deal, just a selection of maybe 20-ish cooked items and 15 or so sushi/sashimi options, but everything listed looked absolutely lovely and we had a hard time choosing. Next time, we're going to starve ourselves for the day before we head out to Hi Sushi Salsa, as we didn't have the appetite to take full advantage of the abundance of yummy food. It isn't very often you have someone waving free sashimi in your face. The quality of the fish was, considering the price, quite extraordinary. It would have fit in just fine at other more pricey Camden sushi joints like Bento or Sushi Waka. With buffet or all-you-care-to-eat places like this, it is easy to overlook shoddy quality so long as you feel like you got your money's worth, but Hi Sushi Salsa provided fantastic quality as well as quantity. With service charges and a flask of sake, our bill came to under £50, and I was more pleasantly stuffed than I've ever been on sushi. Well done, Hi Sushi Salsa!

HIQplrJjRfXSX7ySTxscEQ.text: All-you-can-eat sushi at a fixed price? Too good to be true. The sushi is not exactly bottomless as you are only allowed to order certain dishes a fixed number of times, but having said that, my friends and I have never once managed to eat more than we are allowed, though the allowance for the good stuff runs out fairly quickly. If you, like me, are vegetarian, then stick to the ala carte menu as the vegetarian buffet selection is not particularly extensive. Service however is not five-star. During one visit with a group of friends for a birthday do, I was a little offended when the staff refused to let me order from the ala carte menu, implying that I would have my friends (all of whom were having the buffet) to order some food off the buffet menu for me discreetly. They relented in the end but it was still pretty annoying.

3_tJ48VQCOWJa9hF-k9sbQ.text: One of my favorite sushi places. great food and an amazing atmoshphere. great sashimi, but ask for it chilled- its even better. make sure you book if you are going on the weekend.

o5VU-2dw9oTMztXvvdHz6Q.text: Parental guidance. The following contains some sexual content: "Ohhh myyy gooosssh" were the words that came out of my mouth. I probably even *jizzed* my pants a little when the food arrived... Me and my mates came here for the sushi "buffet" one evening. I use quotation marks because it's not exactly all you can eat, as will be explained. We needn't reserve a table, plus every time I've come here it has been pretty quiet. The restaurant is low lit and trendy, and you get to sit on the floor just the way the Japanese do it (well almost). It's not obvious that they serve buffet unless you ask. They then give you a slip of paper where you select what you want to eat from the selection of sushi listed. You can order up to five times. PLUS, they serve a selection of hot Japanese food as well but that can only be ordered once. Now although it's not exactly "all you can eat", the platters of sushi succeeded in gratifying 5 sushi lovers! We were beat by the 3rd round! We couldn't go on any longer... But it was more than worth it, at £16.80 each it was a bargain!

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Round 1...
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. more food...
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Hot food

wzhpF2dwHBCsCUSbmejLNg.text: I remember I saved up all my tips for a few weeks to splurge on the AYCE menu!As the "American" and Californian, sushi in the AYCE form usually means it's been sitting out for quite a while and hopelessly staring at the passer-by with hopes of being the "CHOSEN." However, Hi Sushi makes it as you order it.The staff provided my native London friend and I will a menu and a dry erase marker. As a result, we planned out our 5 rounds of food which included appetizers, all the sushi and dessert.Just a note, there is a 2 hour limit so you best prepare yourself to eat efficiently paired with the amazing ability of enjoying the food and having a fruitful conversation simultaneously!For the Americans, the sushi is smaller that our American sizes, but you should expect that! It's European portions (no offense intended, I like how I don't have to ask for a to-go box).I recall the restaurant being loud due to the music. My friend and I had to yell at each other just to hold a conversation.Until next time, happy travels and grubbin' across the pond!

DygHkRB3PSZiApDKLduoRw.text: I was so weirded out by the rules and multiple menus this place had going on that I left before even ordered.I didn't want to over spend on the triple filtered water available on tap at my table before indulging in sushi. Sorry, I'm not ok paying a quid for your weird water.There are a bunch of sushi places on Parkway--go there...

IA9VFEKaF_lz3NOj8tO1DA.text: After much badgering by my partner, I finally went to Hi Sushi. A group of us went last night and I must admit, I was approaching it with some trepidation - I occasionally will have an Itsu if no other option presents itself, but I'm not absolutely crazy about sushi. On top of that, the Hi Sushi she wanted to go to is in Camden - I really am not a fan of Camden, finding it too alternative for my old man pub drinking tastes, I am glad I did jump out of my comfort zone though for a few reasons.The food is good (I've seen a few people reviewing and complaining that the quality isn't what you expect; if you want  top end sushi and the price it comes with then go to Roka. To complain about quality of sushi at a place that has an all you can eat option is really narrow-minded and expecting way too much) and really is plentiful. The one-off dishes that you can order add a really nice splash of variety to the standard sushi that I'm certainly used to from Itsu, and the atmosphere really is cool, with a few animes in the background, good music and the oft-mentioned seating in the floor (I admit it completely threw me at first, raised more than a few laughs from our party). The staff, whilst on occasion a little bit wayward with their attention, were really friendly when they were on hand, even giving you some joking encouragement to keep eating into the third platter they brought out ('is he your boyfriend? I wouldn't bring him next time, he really isn't helping you and your friends finish this lot off! maybe bring another girl') They really did want you to get your moneys worth.All in all, I really enjoyed the food (especially the price) and the atmosphere at Hi Sushi, and whilst I won't be rushing back to the one in Camden (because it's in Camden more than anything else) I will certainly recommend it to family and friends and will be locating the nearest one to me in either Wapping or Kings Road.

rxus0zKVp7AyxsjMxzLo6A.text: As a Californian, I'm always craving sushi whenever I'm overseas and I'm so happy I found Sushi Salsa. The location was a little hard to find at first, but I wasn't at all disappointed once I got there. The decoration as soon as you walk in is amazing with the bridge and small river under The sushi chefs are all in a drop down kitchen as soon as you walk into the restaurant. I love the unique seating here with the "drop down" tables and there is lots of leg space under the table. Whenever I order sashmi, the fish always tastes really fresh, no matter the time of day I come here. All the fruity cocktails here is also really good and are the perfect amount of sweetness for my liking. The service here is quick, though sometimes all the other food will come out and the rolls take a lot longer which is awkward when in a group and everyone else is waiting for you to get your food so they can all begin eating, but I can't really fault anyone for that Sushi Salsa has become my go to place to satisfy my sushi craving whenever I'm in London.

Ospql0ejN6u6m-7alfay-A.text: Great looking but tasteless sushi.The customers are very trendy, staff are good looking and the decor looks amazing. The cocktails taste great and look okay.The food looks good but is expensive for a very mediocre taste.  For example the sashimi looks great on ice, but just like how serving a bad white wine very chilled covers up it's cheap taste it seems to be the same for the sashimi. Better tasting and value sushi can be found at genuine independent japanese places auto of course they are not so trendy looking to westerners who do not know any better. The waiting staff were nice but not overly friendly, it could be seen that they did not have huge love for each other and that bled into their customer service.Not cheap and good for impressing flashy people who do not know sny better.

7Z62K8SoYrXSJz8etJ3LtQ.text: We were originally going to go to another all-you-can-eat sushi place in Soho, but this one was more convenient and, according to my friends, a lot nicer than the other one.  It's right by Camden Lock, and surprisingly nice inside, like a kind of place where you would not be surprised to find groups of young professionals relaxing after work.  It's a traditional Japanese type of seating, with "drop-down" type tables, and I actually like that it's a bit authentic. The buffet is £18.80 and you get one round of hot food (5 items, we got fried salmon, calamari skewers, fried calamari, shrimp tempura, and gyoza), 1 order of specials (another 5 items, we got clam sashimi, prawn nigiri, and some other nice items...), and then 5 rounds of regular sushi (5 items each, for 5 people they gave us 18 pieces per item). The hot food and the specials went well, then we were amazed at the amount of food for the regular sushi. I think the best value of the ordinary items is the salmon sashimi, where they just pile fresh salmon, but 18 pieces of the actual sushi is really difficult to finish. It's fairly ordinary stuff, like a California roll, or a spicy tuna roll, but nothing spectacular. It was a good meal after 1 round of the regular sushi, but we really struggled to eat much on the 2nd round. But of course, they charge £5/person for food wastage, and we got told off by the waitress when we asked for our bill, so we put in our best efforts and maybe left like 10 pieces on various plates. Overall, I think these things are fun once in a while, but the fun stops when you have to force feed yourself, so be warned about the large portions that come with the regular sushi.

RBmRWnlYReLXwREqu1VB-g.text: So maybe the first time i went, they were having an off day.My boyfriend and i went one evening and had the all you can eat buffet. and it was awesome. They give you two menus  - a hot one that you can order once from, and a cold sushi one that you can order from 7 times!!!! The hot food was banging and the sushi hit the spot completely. The waiters are just kind of there. They take the little order cards and occasionally walk by so you can flag one down for a drink, but the service isnt why you're there. The table next to us were getting all kinds of yummy looking things from the regular menu, so i may have to splurge some time and go back. for £40, we each had a drink and enough food to roll us through to the next day.Colour me happy.

TX2nvlswHqDta0Z4sCTiSw.text: Get ready for my shortest Yelp review to date:The price is right, but the quality suffers for it. I've had better. Much much better. I won't be returning when next I visit London.

GR_Gf6Ui3tp5EZcqJznEyQ.text: Great all you can eat place! Delicious sushi, good value. Nice decor too, you eat low on the floor (but there's space for your legs under the table) - which creates a nice communal feel. Perfect for a big group - say 6-10 people.

TX0ST-6kWJtBmjCw1G1VQA.text: Excellent place if you love sushi. The setting is nice inside, service is really good. Friendly staff. Food is delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Yummy food!

yIAA5ZlEvhhe332STkar8A.text: I can't believe anyone would think this place is overpriced! I think it's one of the best bargain restaurants out there, with excellent food and fresh, quality ingredients to achieve a great level sushi, it's one of the most affordable places in London for Japanese eating. I wouldn't want to pay any lower as I wouldn't want to compromise on the quality of ingredients!Other great bonuses of this restaurant are the sunterrace by the canal that gives it that awsome "only in London" feel making it an absolut haven for the summer times and on Saturdays when they have DJs palying, it's just perfect to set the mood before heading out to Clubland.On the downside are the overeager staff that have been moulded into robots of the table turning conveyor belt mentality, reining supreme in the restaurant industry in London today. Forgive them father, they do not know better. They do achieve absolution with great ambiance and food though so personally, I'm good.

pG1cwyAWp7fjDAdYfJb_NQ.text: I don't really want to give this place 3 stars but for £16 all you can eat sushi I feel I'll definitely be back... I just can't resist...Basically, to save this being a huuuuge review:Things I don't like:- I called and booked a table, they confirmed it, a table for 5 and took my mobile number. When we arrived the lady at the door rudely told us there was no table.- We were told we could only stay for an hour and 15 minutes, annoying as we were there for a birthday meal, although they told us even people with bookings are only allowed to stay for an hour and a half!- Ordering from the all you can eat menu was SO complicated, there are some really weird rules on only ordering certain things once, being able to double up on other things and only choosing a set number of different dishes for the table.- Some of the sushi came COVERED in bright orange mayonnaise... Gross.- The hot squid dish we had tasted old and was really chewy.- Sorry, the music was too loud... and terribleThings I do like:- The sushi and sashimi without the orange gunk tasted surprisingly fresh!- The tempura was actually pretty good, not too greasy and not soggy at all.- The ambiance (bar the music) was cool, I love how they've decorated the place.- You can eat all you like... sashimi.- THE PRICE THE PRICE THE PRICE!!!!!!!!!!

A7KVA5JDFUFUHVUkEyQr8w.text: Hi Sushi is one of those places where you walk in the door and think why have I not been here before!I came here today for the first time and it was spectacular!The layout of the place is great, a mix of Japanese and modern architecture! the illusion that  people are sitting half lotus when if fact the seats are enclosed in the floorboards is quite cool.I had the bento box for £11, miso soup, salmon sushi, prawn tempura and salad... I was really full afterwards! we went for a bottle of the malbec which set us back £13.50 which is pretty average for a bottle of wine I guess!10/10 for the service also, our waiter was very attentive, I never had to ask for my water glass to be topped up which was nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom

WZb06LWb8EX1YookuuLbIQ.text: So, this place is in CamdenTown, in the market (area near the water). Since CamdenTown is so hip, funky, grunge, and punk, I wasn't really expecting a sushi place other than maybe a cart. The place is beautiful, and you can opt to eat inside or out on the patio.  We ate inside, and enjoyed the seating on the floor- you get on the floor, but there's an opening for your feet under the table. I was leery at first, but it was great.The food was great, both the sushi and the cooked food boxes.Biggest complaint: TOO EXPENSIVE for where it is, and  the clientele of this particular location.  Waaaaaaaay overpriced. I mean,waaaay over priced. For that, minus 2 stars.

_HGKM_i9qFyq3_Gp01T8vw.text: Wow! Walking into this place I imediatley felt like a Giesha.. I just wish I was wearing my Kimono that day.Oh honestly, this place is incredable, you feel like you have been teleported to Japan. The place felt so elemental with running water, cusions as seating and softly spoken smiley and mediative waitors. I didn't really want to leave to be honest, the energy here gave me goose bumps as it was so gentle! being an avid Suishi fan myself, I found the food delicious and not at all expensive. The whole experience made me feel like I had been to a Spa for the weekend. Oh bliss.....

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom

aN3efGH2-dIT1ZTu_mJ41Q.text: Yea, yea, yea, all you can eat.Twas decent, would go back for it.I found the location a little hard to find, however, if one is using google maps. It isn't actually ON the street google says it is on, but the BACK side of the street, along the canal. See? There. I've saved you at least 13 minutes of confusion.You can thank me later when you are stuffing your face with ayce pickle rolls (which I love, btw, don't make knock it till you've tried it).

ILgLOywsyJ9bgb699OOTIA.text: I have been to this restaurant many times and have always received extremely bad service and an attitude from the staff. However, we enjoy the 'all you can eat' sushi deal, so we went back for a friend's birthday this past Sunday. The staff were completely unhelpful and rude when we asked for two separate order forms for such a large group and then demanded that people who weren't taking part in the buffet (soon to become known as the lucky ones) sit away from the rest of the buffet eaters.However, we decided to stay there as we were excited about the buffet and did not want to ruin our friend's birthday meal.Of the 14 people who attended the dinner, EIGHT are now suffering from horrible food poisoning. This includes both fish eaters and vegetarians. I am posting this because this should not be ignored and I hope my comments will influence others to eat somewhere else! Bento Cafe is very near by on Parkway and is delicious and fresh with friendly staff. My suggestion is to eat there instead.Be warned!

qv4HhmrkdfUzNCiupX83Dg.text: So far the biggest japanese sushi restaurant i've ever been with a really cosy, fascinating and best japanese interior. Got to love the table and the way you'll sit like a proper japanese!The sushi all you can eat buffet is really good for groups and parties, yet there's time limit for the buffet option. Good value for money, and a good dine in experience around Camden Lock. ;)

Fmk7C8ZvHPYy14BAYqSrvw.text: Best sushi I had in London!Fresh and taste just how they should!The selection is great!The interior is quirky and cosy!Love it!

eZrgqa_C_xdUToSk_DFP0A.text: Do you like quirky restaurants with funky decoration? This is what you can expect at Sushi Salsa. You get to cross a bridge before sitting in a typical japanese-style hole-in-the-ground booth. Epic.The food is pretty decent and decent value for money. It's a great break off the busy streets of Camden before you go back for a shop.

mYcUENE0Ya7YBcdnKqPPVA.text: This review if for the AYCE aspect only. The regular hand rolls are comparable to those sold at Tesco Express in the deli section. In terms of value, you pick 5 items by filling in a bubble. The staff then makes the decision how much to bring you based on the number of people in your party. Another gentlemen orders the AYCE and his portions that were brought seemed the same as our portions for 2 people. Perhaps living in So Cal we are spoiled with the abundance of fresh fish and fantastic AYCE  restaurants. We thought we would give it a try and we did. Box checked, won't return.Other Concerns: 1) Sitting on the floor: Initially, this is cool I thought. Then I saw the frowning face of the wait staff who has to literally bend over to take your order etc. Had a couple spills of water and sauce as a result of this bending. Also, watch your fingers as they may be stepped on. I also saw a wait staff trip over a seat cushion. Good thing she wasn't carrying hot tea. Finally, I found it challenging to get up again at the end of the meal. I could just image the added issues if I had some saki or other drinks. Yikes!2) Welcoming Environment: I didn't feel very welcomed when I cane in. No one said goodbye when I left either. 3) Bill: Price is now 23 pounds for AYCE. Comparable to the states with regards to price, but that is where the comparison ends.

auioKds7EhjeFVNfpae-Pw.text: I had a craving for ramen. I added a spicy salmon roll since it sounded good. Ramen was good, acceptable. And the roll was good as well. It isn't a place I will remember from my travels but it was conveniently located and cured my ramen fix. They do take away, which is also handy.

upuivKps4JjqK0ZDNuC2qg.text: This review is for "All you can eat" at Sushi Salsa:Here is how it works - within 1.5 hours, you get 5 rounds of sushi with up to 5 items each round. You also get one round to order up to 7 hot food items and one round to order other special sushi items.All orders are made according to the number of people in the group. The sushi isn't the best but it's pretty fresh for all you can eat. My favorite item from the all you can eat menu was the salmon sashimi and my least favorite was the salmon skin roll - the fried salmon skin was too soggy. There's also a pretty good selection for hot items but they can be filling! I recommend the shrimp tempura and agedashi tofu. One of my complaints is for the spicy rolls. These are prepped and cut the same way regular rolls are, but served with spicy mayo on top of each piece. I would've liked it more if the spicy mayo was mixed with the fish first then rolled and cut into individual pieces.Besides that, everything else was satisfactory! The staff were attentive despite how large and busy the restaurant was. They constantly refilled our teas and waters, removed our empty plates and were timely to take our orders.Overall, Sushi Salsa doesn't serve the best sushi in town but it definitely does a pretty good deal for all you can eat considering the price and the quality of the fish. I'd recommend this place for strictly that.

X3Y4FwPeeVjWFPGv5ti5GA.text: Came in and ordered the beef short ribs, shrimp fried rice, some rolls, and salmon sashimi. Awesome taste and great ambiance. Exactly what I was looking for to start my vacation off.

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Salmon Sashimi
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp Fried Rice
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Beef Short Ribs

kwTUhiFhviQ5bJr9rbs4TA.text: This place does do an excellent buffet option which I think was about £18pp for as much sushi as you can eat. You also get a choice of up to 5 hot items on a separate menu. I would give it 5* based on the quality, price, decor and portion size. However, they do have probably the most miserable staff I've ever seen. When not serving you can see them congregating in little groups chatting and giving customers dirty looks. Your made to feel awkward and you shouldn't dare interrupt their conversation with any possible requests or questions you may have.

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom

4S1w3xEUWI16K1RC6wQ3Fw.text: I love sushi and I came by this place so many times after going to the Camden good market and finally went there yesterday. We went for the all you can eat buffet which is £19.80 for 1.5 hrs which doesn't seem cheap but it is compared to what you get. We were 3 people and you can order 5 rounds of sushi choosing 5 different types of sushi each time. The sushi is freshly prepared then and tastes amazing! In addition to that you can order 7 other dishes which were really good too. In the beginning you might think it won't be enough but we didn't come further then round 3 of 5 before we almost rolled out of there. The atmosphere is really nice and there are two open kitchens. The staff is really friendly and welcoming. They charge you if you leave to much food behind but I think that's a good thing to do, know your limits! As I loved the place and the sushi, I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom

2qDQOmjyB2lceqIG5j8JAg.text: Great sushi place on Camden Lock, loving the fact you can be outside in the sun (when the suns out! Occasionally, that dies happen!) Never actuallt had food inside, but its got a japonese style with low tables, makes you feel like a giant!!! Lots of choice - sashimi is great but highlight for me was dragon roll and salsa roll - big one of 8 pieces are huge!! Super tasty and very filling!!! Friendly service too - helpful when i came with my niece!Definitly recommend it if your in the area - this is going to become a habit for my lunchbreaks!

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Salsa roll!!! Loving the softshell crab!
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Dragon roll!!!!!
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. 9 piece sashimi - tuna, salmon & seabass

gzvrAyHt4c6gLBtMwRfsSw.text: We came here on a date night a few months ago but neither of us were quite hungry enough to stuff ourselves with sushi, so decided to try the Ramen instead. I might still come back to fill my belly with all you can eat sushi another day.Awesome-sauce:- It looks nice. I like the dug in tables in Japan, but haven't seen them in the UK- The menu is quite extensive and not too pricey- My (slightly strange sounding) tonkatsu ramen was interesting. It was a bit like a mixture of katsudon and ramen.Less impressive:- It's not uber-authentic and seems to be run by Chinese staff (you can see the notices to staff are all in Chinese.) this isn't a biggy, just don't expect to order in Japanese.- The ramen were a bit too squishy and the broth was a bit salty. I've had far better in LondonPro tip:  If there is no 'tabehodai' (all you can eat menu), just ask for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Tokatsu ramen (yep...I said Tonkatsu, not Tonkotsu!) This was interesting...kind of half way between katsudon and ramen!!
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Gyoza (these make Marc happy)
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Avocado and salmon sushi - not bad

5LgZlPUqHL2LENd3YTQCwg.text: Being from Canada having a great wifi connect is important when choosing a restaurant. Sushi Salsa not only has a very strong wifi connection it has a very strong menu of food and spectacular service. Thanks Nikola. Highly recommend. Our food was fantastic!

gcOaKJ_MQu0OR1Uc5M49AA.text: Tables are configured kind of weird and they don't take American Express. I hate that. Sitting on the floor seemed to show much more potential than it delivered. It is a big, fancy, corporate looking restaurant. It holds a lot of people too. It is not cheap and not that small "Japanese" style sushi place I like. Kind of cold and busy. But the menus were odd and extensive but I've enjoyed other sushi restaurants in the area more. I'm not saying the food isn't good, just that the atmosphere could be a bit more enticing.

GVjeHKAvQTB9EThqE6RGMg.text: Hands down the best sushi i've ever had! The staff doesnt seem to care about the customers and the wait for the food was long, but who cares when the sushi is this fresh and delicious? I mean the staff was not awful, it just took a lot of waving to get their attention and even after that it took a while for them to help us out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Look at the amount of salmon in that!
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom

Z-NzAJgEAsE0z6-GJO5Xzw.text: this place is incredible! the sushi is delicious and well prepared. The cooks definitely know what they're going here. I had an avocado roll and eel nigiri (with unagi) everything was put together beautifully and tasted very very fresh. if only I lived in London, I would be here all the time.

SBl3FH8n7u1BD7lM9hTdyg.text: One of the best sushi places I've been to. Food is fresh and staff are nice. It's always very busy though and there is a queue to be seated. Only thing that puts me off is that it's relatively expensive but you get what you pay for. The restaurant is very cosy and the seating on the floor is cool.

sSCGNkTlhMirgC6HTizF4g.text: Great quality sushi for an "All you can eat". Not technically an all you can eat but you get 5 rounds of sushi to order 5 dishes per round and another round of hot food. The fish is fresh and has a good fish to rice ratio.

Xz2n92bTw47304gjpHAYpg.text: Since it is a review for food, I am honest that the food was nicely presented and was delicious for the pricey tag. The ambience was quite trendy and almost top class. The main let down was the service of the staff there. I understand that many will not agree with me but sometimes when I dine, I like the relax friendly feel to the people who are working there and it really disappoints me the staff are very mundane and of course I don't expect them to jump around like circus animals!When we ordered, the waitress had the biggest frown and when she met our ways put a 1 second smile. when they served the food on the plate they didn't land it in front of us but slid it like a dog bowl and the soup even spilt. No eye contact and just quick serving ready to get rid of us. My boyfriend put the plate to one side and it was clear it wasn't finish because we put it on our side and the woman bent forward to pick it up just before my boyfriend started to reach for the plate to finish it. we felt embarrassed to stop her because she was so quick and didn't ask us if we were finished at all.

apTp0RIanL6g5urbT47APw.text: I understand the good reviews. Ordered take away and the sushi is very ordinary and ridiculously overpriced. I don't mind paying up for sushi but it has to be good.The spicy tuna roll had no spicy sauce in it, the yellowtail carpaccio was hacked to bits and was tasteless, the prawn tempura roll also tasteless and charging so much for only 1 piece of nigiri is crazy. I would not be ordering from here again

pJjQT4ihUvBRY0H_Kb7bQg.text: Food: This is more of a quantity (all-you-can-eat) over quality type placeAtmosphere: Love the overall look and the sitting on the floor aspectService: DecentPrice: 16.80 GBP is pretty good considering how much food most people can consume here AND the general price of sushi in the UK

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Sushi Selection
Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. Fried Everything!

6-GA3lwq5L07gvOIPdsuaQ.text: One of the few all you can eats that has nice sushi (you might have to make mention of AYCE as it is not highlighted in the menu) - spacious and well staffed. In the middle of hectic Camden it is a calm oasis with sunken seats, nice decor (including a small fish pond and bridge at the entrance) and good service. Nice well portioned and reasonably priced food straight from the menu. One warning - there is a charge for over ordering/leftover food - so know your limits!

photos.caption: Photo of Hi Sushi Salsa - London, United Kingdom. All you can eat sushi

UvM0e8jwFZjqTvHr6jIY1Q.text: I've only ever eaten the all you can eat buffet menu.  I will warn you though that your eyes can be bigger than your stomach.  The last time I was here with some friends we ordered slightly too much food, after my friends thinking that they could beat the 3 repeat orders that I said I had never got past.  With the threat of a £10 surcharge per person on any wastage we had to find ways to make the excess appear less than it actually was.The Camden branch is my favourite, with a waterfall in the entrance and seating on the ground and the restaurant is quite spacious.  With the buffet you get to choose one round of items from the hot dish selection and you repeat the cold section as many times as you like (apart from a couple of special order items).  The food has always tasted good and is great value for money.
